page.title: 13CHESTERWOOD, HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: This is a small, nucleated village. Usually, after enclosure, farmhouses were built surrounded by their fields, not so at Chesterwood. Farmhouses remain along its short, cobbled street Once it contained several{Bastles} ,fortified for protection against Border raids. Scots pines remain on its fringes(These are indicators of an ancient forest).Mr.Pigg & Mr.Wardle are the principal farmers. Several houses are occupied by retired executives or commuters to Newcastle. Some large barns have been converted into houses. References in the deeds of the oldest cottage go back to the reign of Elizabeth I; possibly the cottage is older still. The finest house,{Chesterwood Grange,}stands 200 yards from the village.
